93  /**
94   * Tool to load the output of HFileOutputFormat into an existing table.
95   * @see #usage()
96   */
97  @InterfaceAudience.Public
98  @InterfaceStability.Stable
99  public class LoadIncrementalHFiles extends Configured implements Tool {
100   private static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(LoadIncrementalHFiles.class);
101   static final AtomicLong regionCount = new AtomicLong(0);
102   private HBaseAdmin hbAdmin;
103   private Configuration cfg;
104 
105   public static final String NAME = "completebulkload";
106   public static final String MAX_FILES_PER_REGION_PER_FAMILY
107     = "hbase.mapreduce.bulkload.max.hfiles.perRegion.perFamily";
108   private static final String ASSIGN_SEQ_IDS = "hbase.mapreduce.bulkload.assign.sequenceNumbers";
109 
110   private int maxFilesPerRegionPerFamily;
111   private boolean assignSeqIds;
112 
113   private boolean hasForwardedToken;
114   private Token<?> userToken;
115   private String bulkToken;
116   private UserProvider userProvider;
117 
118   public LoadIncrementalHFiles(Configuration conf) throws Exception {
119     super(conf);
120     this.cfg = conf;
121     this.hbAdmin = new HBaseAdmin(conf);
122     this.userProvider = UserProvider.instantiate(conf);
123     assignSeqIds = conf.getBoolean(ASSIGN_SEQ_IDS, true);
124     maxFilesPerRegionPerFamily = conf.getInt(MAX_FILES_PER_REGION_PER_FAMILY, 32);
125   }
126 
127   private void usage() {
128     System.err.println("usage: " + NAME +
129         " /path/to/hfileoutputformat-output " +
130         "tablename");
131   }
132 
133   /**
134    * Represents an HFile waiting to be loaded. An queue is used
135    * in this class in order to support the case where a region has
136    * split during the process of the load. When this happens,
137    * the HFile is split into two physical parts across the new
138    * region boundary, and each part is added back into the queue.
139    * The import process finishes when the queue is empty.
140    */
141   static class LoadQueueItem {
142     final byte[] family;
143     final Path hfilePath;
144 
145     public LoadQueueItem(byte[] family, Path hfilePath) {
146       this.family = family;
147       this.hfilePath = hfilePath;
148     }
149 
150     public String toString() {
151       return "family:"+ Bytes.toString(family) + " path:" + hfilePath.toString();
152     }
153   }
154 
155   /**
156    * Walk the given directory for all HFiles, and return a Queue
157    * containing all such files.
158    */
159   private void discoverLoadQueue(Deque<LoadQueueItem> ret, Path hfofDir)
160   throws IOException {
161     FileSystem fs = hfofDir.getFileSystem(getConf());
162 
163     if (!fs.exists(hfofDir)) {
164       throw new FileNotFoundException("HFileOutputFormat dir " +
165           hfofDir + " not found");
166     }
167 
168     FileStatus[] familyDirStatuses = fs.listStatus(hfofDir);
169     if (familyDirStatuses == null) {
170       throw new FileNotFoundException("No families found in " + hfofDir);
171     }
172 
173     for (FileStatus stat : familyDirStatuses) {
174       if (!stat.isDir()) {
175         LOG.warn("Skipping non-directory " + stat.getPath());
176         continue;
177       }
178       Path familyDir = stat.getPath();
179       // Skip _logs, etc
180       if (familyDir.getName().startsWith("_")) continue;
181       byte[] family = familyDir.getName().getBytes();
182       Path[] hfiles = FileUtil.stat2Paths(fs.listStatus(familyDir));
183       for (Path hfile : hfiles) {
184         if (hfile.getName().startsWith("_")) continue;
185         ret.add(new LoadQueueItem(family, hfile));
186       }
187     }
188   }
189 
190   /**
191    * Perform a bulk load of the given directory into the given
192    * pre-existing table.  This method is not threadsafe.
193    *
194    * @param hfofDir the directory that was provided as the output path
195    * of a job using HFileOutputFormat
196    * @param table the table to load into
197    * @throws TableNotFoundException if table does not yet exist
198    */
199   @SuppressWarnings("deprecation")
200   public void doBulkLoad(Path hfofDir, final HTable table)
201     throws TableNotFoundException, IOException
202   {
203     final HConnection conn = table.getConnection();
204 
205     if (!conn.isTableAvailable(table.getName())) {
206       throw new TableNotFoundException("Table " +
207           Bytes.toStringBinary(table.getTableName()) +
208           "is not currently available.");
209     }
210 
211     // initialize thread pools
212     int nrThreads = cfg.getInt("hbase.loadincremental.threads.max",
213         Runtime.getRuntime().availableProcessors());
214     ThreadFactoryBuilder builder = new ThreadFactoryBuilder();
215     builder.setNameFormat("LoadIncrementalHFiles-%1$d");
216     ExecutorService pool = new ThreadPoolExecutor(nrThreads, nrThreads,
217         60, TimeUnit.SECONDS,
218         new LinkedBlockingQueue<Runnable>(),
219         builder.build());
220     ((ThreadPoolExecutor)pool).allowCoreThreadTimeOut(true);
221 
222     // LQI queue does not need to be threadsafe -- all operations on this queue
223     // happen in this thread
224     Deque<LoadQueueItem> queue = new LinkedList<LoadQueueItem>();
225     try {
226       discoverLoadQueue(queue, hfofDir);
227       // check whether there is invalid family name in HFiles to be bulkloaded
228       Collection<HColumnDescriptor> families = table.getTableDescriptor().getFamilies();
229       ArrayList<String> familyNames = new ArrayList<String>();
230       for (HColumnDescriptor family : families) {
231         familyNames.add(family.getNameAsString());
232       }
233       ArrayList<String> unmatchedFamilies = new ArrayList<String>();
234       for (LoadQueueItem lqi : queue) {
235         String familyNameInHFile = Bytes.toString(lqi.family);
236         if (!familyNames.contains(familyNameInHFile)) {
237           unmatchedFamilies.add(familyNameInHFile);
238         }
239       }
240       if (unmatchedFamilies.size() > 0) {
241         String msg =
242             "Unmatched family names found: unmatched family names in HFiles to be bulkloaded: "
243                 + unmatchedFamilies + "; valid family names of table "
244                 + Bytes.toString(table.getTableName()) + " are: " + familyNames;
245         LOG.error(msg);
246         throw new IOException(msg);
247       }
248       int count = 0;
249 
250       if (queue.isEmpty()) {
251         LOG.warn("Bulk load operation did not find any files to load in " +
252             "directory " + hfofDir.toUri() + ".  Does it contain files in " +
253             "subdirectories that correspond to column family names?");
254         return;
255       }
256 
257       //If using secure bulk load
258       //prepare staging directory and token
259       if (userProvider.isHBaseSecurityEnabled()) {
260         FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(cfg);
261         //This condition is here for unit testing
262         //Since delegation token doesn't work in mini cluster
263         if (userProvider.isHadoopSecurityEnabled()) {
264           userToken = userProvider.getCurrent().getToken("HDFS_DELEGATION_TOKEN",
265                                                          fs.getCanonicalServiceName());
266           if (userToken == null) {
267             hasForwardedToken = false;
268             userToken = fs.getDelegationToken("renewer");
269           } else {
270             hasForwardedToken = true;
271             LOG.info("Use the existing token: " + userToken);
272           }
273         }
274         bulkToken = new SecureBulkLoadClient(table).prepareBulkLoad(table.getName());
275       }
276 
277       // Assumes that region splits can happen while this occurs.
278       while (!queue.isEmpty()) {
279         // need to reload split keys each iteration.
280         final Pair<byte[][], byte[][]> startEndKeys = table.getStartEndKeys();
281         if (count != 0) {
282           LOG.info("Split occured while grouping HFiles, retry attempt " +
283               + count + " with " + queue.size() + " files remaining to group or split");
284         }
285 
286         int maxRetries = cfg.getInt("hbase.bulkload.retries.number", 0);
287         if (maxRetries != 0 && count >= maxRetries) {
288           LOG.error("Retry attempted " + count +  " times without completing, bailing out");
289           return;
290         }
291         count++;
292 
293         // Using ByteBuffer for byte[] equality semantics
294         Multimap<ByteBuffer, LoadQueueItem> regionGroups = groupOrSplitPhase(table,
295             pool, queue, startEndKeys);
296 
297         if (!checkHFilesCountPerRegionPerFamily(regionGroups)) {
298           // Error is logged inside checkHFilesCountPerRegionPerFamily.
299           throw new IOException("Trying to load more than " + maxFilesPerRegionPerFamily
300             + " hfiles to one family of one region");
301         }
302 
303         bulkLoadPhase(table, conn, pool, queue, regionGroups);
304 
305         // NOTE: The next iteration's split / group could happen in parallel to
306         // atomic bulkloads assuming that there are splits and no merges, and
307         // that we can atomically pull out the groups we want to retry.
308       }
309 
310     } finally {
311       if (userProvider.isHBaseSecurityEnabled()) {
312         if (userToken != null && !hasForwardedToken) {
313           try {
314             userToken.cancel(cfg);
315           } catch (Exception e) {
316             LOG.warn("Failed to cancel HDFS delegation token.", e);
317           }
318         }
319         if(bulkToken != null) {
320           new SecureBulkLoadClient(table).cleanupBulkLoad(bulkToken);
321         }
322       }
323       pool.shutdown();
324       if (queue != null && !queue.isEmpty()) {
325         StringBuilder err = new StringBuilder();
326         err.append("-------------------------------------------------\n");
327         err.append("Bulk load aborted with some files not yet loaded:\n");
328         err.append("-------------------------------------------------\n");
329         for (LoadQueueItem q : queue) {
330           err.append("  ").append(q.hfilePath).append('\n');
331         }
332         LOG.error(err);
333       }
334     }
335     
336     if (queue != null && !queue.isEmpty()) {
337         throw new RuntimeException("Bulk load aborted with some files not yet loaded."
338           + "Please check log for more details.");
339     }
340   }
341 
342   /**
343    * This takes the LQI's grouped by likely regions and attempts to bulk load
344    * them.  Any failures are re-queued for another pass with the
345    * groupOrSplitPhase.
346    */
347   protected void bulkLoadPhase(final HTable table, final HConnection conn,
348       ExecutorService pool, Deque<LoadQueueItem> queue,
349       final Multimap<ByteBuffer, LoadQueueItem> regionGroups) throws IOException {
350     // atomically bulk load the groups.
351     Set<Future<List<LoadQueueItem>>> loadingFutures = new HashSet<Future<List<LoadQueueItem>>>();
352     for (Entry<ByteBuffer, ? extends Collection<LoadQueueItem>> e: regionGroups.asMap().entrySet()) {
353       final byte[] first = e.getKey().array();
354       final Collection<LoadQueueItem> lqis =  e.getValue();
355 
356       final Callable<List<LoadQueueItem>> call = new Callable<List<LoadQueueItem>>() {
357         public List<LoadQueueItem> call() throws Exception {
358           List<LoadQueueItem> toRetry =
359               tryAtomicRegionLoad(conn, table.getName(), first, lqis);
360           return toRetry;
361         }
362       };
363       loadingFutures.add(pool.submit(call));
364     }
365 
366     // get all the results.
367     for (Future<List<LoadQueueItem>> future : loadingFutures) {
368       try {
369         List<LoadQueueItem> toRetry = future.get();
370 
371         // LQIs that are requeued to be regrouped.
372         queue.addAll(toRetry);
373 
374       } catch (ExecutionException e1) {
375         Throwable t = e1.getCause();
376         if (t instanceof IOException) {
377           // At this point something unrecoverable has happened.
378           // TODO Implement bulk load recovery
379           throw new IOException("BulkLoad encountered an unrecoverable problem", t);
380         }
381         LOG.error("Unexpected execution exception during bulk load", e1);
382         throw new IllegalStateException(t);
383       } catch (InterruptedException e1) {
384         LOG.error("Unexpected interrupted exception during bulk load", e1);
385         throw new IllegalStateException(e1);
386       }
387     }
388   }
389 
390   private boolean checkHFilesCountPerRegionPerFamily(
391       final Multimap<ByteBuffer, LoadQueueItem> regionGroups) {
392     for (Entry<ByteBuffer,
393         ? extends Collection<LoadQueueItem>> e: regionGroups.asMap().entrySet()) {
394       final Collection<LoadQueueItem> lqis =  e.getValue();
395       HashMap<byte[], MutableInt> filesMap = new HashMap<byte[], MutableInt>();
396       for (LoadQueueItem lqi: lqis) {
397         MutableInt count = filesMap.get(lqi.family);
398         if (count == null) {
399           count = new MutableInt();
400           filesMap.put(lqi.family, count);
401         }
402         count.increment();
403         if (count.intValue() > maxFilesPerRegionPerFamily) {
404           LOG.error("Trying to load more than " + maxFilesPerRegionPerFamily
405             + " hfiles to family " + Bytes.toStringBinary(lqi.family)
406             + " of region with start key "
407             + Bytes.toStringBinary(e.getKey()));
408           return false;
409         }
410       }
411     }
412     return true;
413   }
414 
415   /**
416    * @return A Multimap<startkey, LoadQueueItem> that groups LQI by likely
417    * bulk load region targets.
418    */
419   private Multimap<ByteBuffer, LoadQueueItem> groupOrSplitPhase(final HTable table,
420       ExecutorService pool, Deque<LoadQueueItem> queue,
421       final Pair<byte[][], byte[][]> startEndKeys) throws IOException {
422     // <region start key, LQI> need synchronized only within this scope of this
423     // phase because of the puts that happen in futures.
424     Multimap<ByteBuffer, LoadQueueItem> rgs = HashMultimap.create();
425     final Multimap<ByteBuffer, LoadQueueItem> regionGroups = Multimaps.synchronizedMultimap(rgs);
426 
427     // drain LQIs and figure out bulk load groups
428     Set<Future<List<LoadQueueItem>>> splittingFutures = new HashSet<Future<List<LoadQueueItem>>>();
429     while (!queue.isEmpty()) {
430       final LoadQueueItem item = queue.remove();
431 
432       final Callable<List<LoadQueueItem>> call = new Callable<List<LoadQueueItem>>() {
433         public List<LoadQueueItem> call() throws Exception {
434           List<LoadQueueItem> splits = groupOrSplit(regionGroups, item, table, startEndKeys);
435           return splits;
436         }
437       };
438       splittingFutures.add(pool.submit(call));
439     }
440     // get all the results.  All grouping and splitting must finish before
441     // we can attempt the atomic loads.
442     for (Future<List<LoadQueueItem>> lqis : splittingFutures) {
443       try {
444         List<LoadQueueItem> splits = lqis.get();
445         if (splits != null) {
446           queue.addAll(splits);
447         }
448       } catch (ExecutionException e1) {
449         Throwable t = e1.getCause();
450         if (t instanceof IOException) {
451           LOG.error("IOException during splitting", e1);
452           throw (IOException)t; // would have been thrown if not parallelized,
453         }
454         LOG.error("Unexpected execution exception during splitting", e1);
455         throw new IllegalStateException(t);
456       } catch (InterruptedException e1) {
457         LOG.error("Unexpected interrupted exception during splitting", e1);
458         throw new IllegalStateException(e1);
459       }
460     }
461     return regionGroups;
462   }
463 
464   // unique file name for the table
465   String getUniqueName(TableName tableName) {
466     String name = tableName + "," + regionCount.incrementAndGet();
467     return name;
468   }
469 
470   protected List<LoadQueueItem> splitStoreFile(final LoadQueueItem item,
471       final HTable table, byte[] startKey,
472       byte[] splitKey) throws IOException {
473     final Path hfilePath = item.hfilePath;
474 
475     // We use a '_' prefix which is ignored when walking directory trees
476     // above.
477     final Path tmpDir = new Path(item.hfilePath.getParent(), "_tmp");
478 
479     LOG.info("HFile at " + hfilePath + " no longer fits inside a single " +
480     "region. Splitting...");
481 
482     String uniqueName = getUniqueName(table.getName());
483     HColumnDescriptor familyDesc = table.getTableDescriptor().getFamily(item.family);
484     Path botOut = new Path(tmpDir, uniqueName + ".bottom");
485     Path topOut = new Path(tmpDir, uniqueName + ".top");
486     splitStoreFile(getConf(), hfilePath, familyDesc, splitKey,
487         botOut, topOut);
488 
489     // Add these back at the *front* of the queue, so there's a lower
490     // chance that the region will just split again before we get there.
491     List<LoadQueueItem> lqis = new ArrayList<LoadQueueItem>(2);
492     lqis.add(new LoadQueueItem(item.family, botOut));
493     lqis.add(new LoadQueueItem(item.family, topOut));
494 
495     LOG.info("Successfully split into new HFiles " + botOut + " and " + topOut);
496     return lqis;
497   }
498 
499   /**
500    * Attempt to assign the given load queue item into its target region group.
501    * If the hfile boundary no longer fits into a region, physically splits
502    * the hfile such that the new bottom half will fit and returns the list of
503    * LQI's corresponding to the resultant hfiles.
504    *
505    * protected for testing
506    */
507   protected List<LoadQueueItem> groupOrSplit(Multimap<ByteBuffer, LoadQueueItem> regionGroups,
508       final LoadQueueItem item, final HTable table,
509       final Pair<byte[][], byte[][]> startEndKeys)
510       throws IOException {
511     final Path hfilePath = item.hfilePath;
512     final FileSystem fs = hfilePath.getFileSystem(getConf());
513     HFile.Reader hfr = HFile.createReader(fs, hfilePath,
514         new CacheConfig(getConf()));
515     final byte[] first, last;
516     try {
517       hfr.loadFileInfo();
518       first = hfr.getFirstRowKey();
519       last = hfr.getLastRowKey();
520     }  finally {
521       hfr.close();
522     }
523 
524     LOG.info("Trying to load hfile=" + hfilePath +
525         " first=" + Bytes.toStringBinary(first) +
526         " last="  + Bytes.toStringBinary(last));
527     if (first == null || last == null) {
528       assert first == null && last == null;
529       // TODO what if this is due to a bad HFile?
530       LOG.info("hfile " + hfilePath + " has no entries, skipping");
531       return null;
532     }
533     if (Bytes.compareTo(first, last) > 0) {
534       throw new IllegalArgumentException(
535       "Invalid range: " + Bytes.toStringBinary(first) +
536       " > " + Bytes.toStringBinary(last));
537     }
538     int idx = Arrays.binarySearch(startEndKeys.getFirst(), first,
539         Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
540     if (idx < 0) {
541       // not on boundary, returns -(insertion index).  Calculate region it
542       // would be in.
543       idx = -(idx + 1) - 1;
544     }
545     final int indexForCallable = idx;
546     boolean lastKeyInRange =
547       Bytes.compareTo(last, startEndKeys.getSecond()[idx]) < 0 ||
548       Bytes.equals(startEndKeys.getSecond()[idx], HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY);
549     if (!lastKeyInRange) {
550       List<LoadQueueItem> lqis = splitStoreFile(item, table,
551           startEndKeys.getFirst()[indexForCallable],
552           startEndKeys.getSecond()[indexForCallable]);
553       return lqis;
554     }
555 
556     // group regions.
557     regionGroups.put(ByteBuffer.wrap(startEndKeys.getFirst()[idx]), item);
558     return null;
559   }
560 
561   /**
562    * @deprecated Use {@link #tryAtomicRegionLoad(HConnection, TableName, byte[], Collection)}
563    */
564   @Deprecated
565   protected List<LoadQueueItem> tryAtomicRegionLoad(final HConnection conn,
566       final byte [] tableName, final byte[] first, Collection<LoadQueueItem> lqis)
567   throws IOException {
568     return tryAtomicRegionLoad(conn, TableName.valueOf(tableName), first, lqis);
569   }
570 
571   /**
572    * Attempts to do an atomic load of many hfiles into a region.  If it fails,
573    * it returns a list of hfiles that need to be retried.  If it is successful
574    * it will return an empty list.
575    *
576    * NOTE: To maintain row atomicity guarantees, region server callable should
577    * succeed atomically and fails atomically.
578    *
579    * Protected for testing.
580    *
581    * @return empty list if success, list of items to retry on recoverable
582    * failure
583    */
584   protected List<LoadQueueItem> tryAtomicRegionLoad(final HConnection conn,
585       final TableName tableName, final byte[] first, Collection<LoadQueueItem> lqis)
586   throws IOException {
587     final List<Pair<byte[], String>> famPaths =
588       new ArrayList<Pair<byte[], String>>(lqis.size());
589     for (LoadQueueItem lqi : lqis) {
590       famPaths.add(Pair.newPair(lqi.family, lqi.hfilePath.toString()));
591     }
592 
593     final RegionServerCallable<Boolean> svrCallable =
594         new RegionServerCallable<Boolean>(conn, tableName, first) {
595       @Override
596       public Boolean call() throws Exception {
597         SecureBulkLoadClient secureClient = null;
598         boolean success = false;
599 
600         try {
601           LOG.debug("Going to connect to server " + getLocation() + " for row "
602               + Bytes.toStringBinary(getRow()) + " with hfile group " + famPaths);
603           byte[] regionName = getLocation().getRegionInfo().getRegionName();
604           if(!userProvider.isHBaseSecurityEnabled()) {
605             success = ProtobufUtil.bulkLoadHFile(getStub(), famPaths, regionName, assignSeqIds);
606           } else {
607             HTable table = new HTable(conn.getConfiguration(), getTableName());
608             secureClient = new SecureBulkLoadClient(table);
609             success = secureClient.bulkLoadHFiles(famPaths, userToken, bulkToken,
610               getLocation().getRegionInfo().getStartKey());
611           }
612           return success;
613         } finally {
614           //Best effort copying of files that might not have been imported
615           //from the staging directory back to original location
616           //in user directory
617           if(secureClient != null && !success) {
618             FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(cfg);
619             for(Pair<byte[], String> el : famPaths) {
620               Path hfileStagingPath = null;
621               Path hfileOrigPath = new Path(el.getSecond());
622               try {
623                 hfileStagingPath= new Path(secureClient.getStagingPath(bulkToken, el.getFirst()),
624                     hfileOrigPath.getName());
625                 if(fs.rename(hfileStagingPath, hfileOrigPath)) {
626                   LOG.debug("Moved back file " + hfileOrigPath + " from " +
627                       hfileStagingPath);
628                 } else if(fs.exists(hfileStagingPath)){
629                   LOG.debug("Unable to move back file " + hfileOrigPath + " from " +
630                       hfileStagingPath);
631                 }
632               } catch(Exception ex) {
633                 LOG.debug("Unable to move back file " + hfileOrigPath + " from " +
634                     hfileStagingPath, ex);
635               }
636             }
637           }
638         }
639       }
640     };
641 
642     try {
643       List<LoadQueueItem> toRetry = new ArrayList<LoadQueueItem>();
644       Configuration conf = getConf();
645       boolean success = RpcRetryingCallerFactory.instantiate(conf).<Boolean> newCaller()
646           .callWithRetries(svrCallable);
647       if (!success) {
648         LOG.warn("Attempt to bulk load region containing "
649             + Bytes.toStringBinary(first) + " into table "
650             + tableName  + " with files " + lqis
651             + " failed.  This is recoverable and they will be retried.");
652         toRetry.addAll(lqis); // return lqi's to retry
653       }
654       // success
655       return toRetry;
656     } catch (IOException e) {
657       LOG.error("Encountered unrecoverable error from region server", e);
658       throw e;
659     }
660   }
661 
662   /**
663    * Split a storefile into a top and bottom half, maintaining
664    * the metadata, recreating bloom filters, etc.
665    */
666   static void splitStoreFile(
667       Configuration conf, Path inFile,
668       HColumnDescriptor familyDesc, byte[] splitKey,
669       Path bottomOut, Path topOut) throws IOException
670   {
671     // Open reader with no block cache, and not in-memory
672     Reference topReference = Reference.createTopReference(splitKey);
673     Reference bottomReference = Reference.createBottomReference(splitKey);
674 
675     copyHFileHalf(conf, inFile, topOut, topReference, familyDesc);
676     copyHFileHalf(conf, inFile, bottomOut, bottomReference, familyDesc);
677   }
678 
679   /**
680    * Copy half of an HFile into a new HFile.
681    */
682   private static void copyHFileHalf(
683       Configuration conf, Path inFile, Path outFile, Reference reference,
684       HColumnDescriptor familyDescriptor)
685   throws IOException {
686     FileSystem fs = inFile.getFileSystem(conf);
687     CacheConfig cacheConf = new CacheConfig(conf);
688     HalfStoreFileReader halfReader = null;
689     StoreFile.Writer halfWriter = null;
690     HFileDataBlockEncoder dataBlockEncoder = new HFileDataBlockEncoderImpl(
691       familyDescriptor.getDataBlockEncoding());
692     try {
693       halfReader = new HalfStoreFileReader(fs, inFile, cacheConf, reference);
694       Map<byte[], byte[]> fileInfo = halfReader.loadFileInfo();
695 
696       int blocksize = familyDescriptor.getBlocksize();
697       Algorithm compression = familyDescriptor.getCompression();
698       BloomType bloomFilterType = familyDescriptor.getBloomFilterType();
699 
700       halfWriter = new StoreFile.WriterBuilder(conf, cacheConf,
701           fs, blocksize)
702               .withFilePath(outFile)
703               .withCompression(compression)
704               .withDataBlockEncoder(dataBlockEncoder)
705               .withBloomType(bloomFilterType)
706               .withChecksumType(HStore.getChecksumType(conf))
707               .withBytesPerChecksum(HStore.getBytesPerChecksum(conf))
708               .build();
709       HFileScanner scanner = halfReader.getScanner(false, false, false);
710       scanner.seekTo();
711       do {
712         KeyValue kv = scanner.getKeyValue();
713         halfWriter.append(kv);
714       } while (scanner.next());
715 
716       for (Map.Entry<byte[],byte[]> entry : fileInfo.entrySet()) {
717         if (shouldCopyHFileMetaKey(entry.getKey())) {
718           halfWriter.appendFileInfo(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
719         }
720       }
721     } finally {
722       if (halfWriter != null) halfWriter.close();
723       if (halfReader != null) halfReader.close(cacheConf.shouldEvictOnClose());
724     }
725   }
726 
727   private static boolean shouldCopyHFileMetaKey(byte[] key) {
728     return !HFile.isReservedFileInfoKey(key);
729   }
730 
731   private boolean doesTableExist(TableName tableName) throws Exception {
732     return hbAdmin.tableExists(tableName);
733   }
734 
735   /*
736    * Infers region boundaries for a new table.
737    * Parameter:
738    *   bdryMap is a map between keys to an integer belonging to {+1, -1}
739    *     If a key is a start key of a file, then it maps to +1
740    *     If a key is an end key of a file, then it maps to -1
741    * Algo:
742    * 1) Poll on the keys in order:
743    *    a) Keep adding the mapped values to these keys (runningSum)
744    *    b) Each time runningSum reaches 0, add the start Key from when the runningSum had started to a boundary list.
745    * 2) Return the boundary list.
746    */
747   public static byte[][] inferBoundaries(TreeMap<byte[], Integer> bdryMap) {
748     ArrayList<byte[]> keysArray = new ArrayList<byte[]>();
749     int runningValue = 0;
750     byte[] currStartKey = null;
751     boolean firstBoundary = true;
752 
753     for (Map.Entry<byte[], Integer> item: bdryMap.entrySet()) {
754       if (runningValue == 0) currStartKey = item.getKey();
755       runningValue += item.getValue();
756       if (runningValue == 0) {
757         if (!firstBoundary) keysArray.add(currStartKey);
758         firstBoundary = false;
759       }
760     }
761 
762     return keysArray.toArray(new byte[0][0]);
763   }
764 
765   /*
766    * If the table is created for the first time, then "completebulkload" reads the files twice.
767    * More modifications necessary if we want to avoid doing it.
768    */
769   private void createTable(TableName tableName, String dirPath) throws Exception {
770     Path hfofDir = new Path(dirPath);
771     FileSystem fs = hfofDir.getFileSystem(getConf());
772 
773     if (!fs.exists(hfofDir)) {
774       throw new FileNotFoundException("HFileOutputFormat dir " +
775           hfofDir + " not found");
776     }
777 
778     FileStatus[] familyDirStatuses = fs.listStatus(hfofDir);
779     if (familyDirStatuses == null) {
780       throw new FileNotFoundException("No families found in " + hfofDir);
781     }
782 
783     HTableDescriptor htd = new HTableDescriptor(tableName);
784     HColumnDescriptor hcd;
785 
786     // Add column families
787     // Build a set of keys
788     byte[][] keys;
789     TreeMap<byte[], Integer> map = new TreeMap<byte[], Integer>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
790 
791     for (FileStatus stat : familyDirStatuses) {
792       if (!stat.isDir()) {
793         LOG.warn("Skipping non-directory " + stat.getPath());
794         continue;
795       }
796       Path familyDir = stat.getPath();
797       // Skip _logs, etc
798       if (familyDir.getName().startsWith("_")) continue;
799       byte[] family = familyDir.getName().getBytes();
800 
801       hcd = new HColumnDescriptor(family);
802       htd.addFamily(hcd);
803 
804       Path[] hfiles = FileUtil.stat2Paths(fs.listStatus(familyDir));
805       for (Path hfile : hfiles) {
806         if (hfile.getName().startsWith("_")) continue;
807         HFile.Reader reader = HFile.createReader(fs, hfile,
808             new CacheConfig(getConf()));
809         final byte[] first, last;
810         try {
811           if (hcd.getCompressionType() != reader.getCompressionAlgorithm()) {
812             hcd.setCompressionType(reader.getCompressionAlgorithm());
813             LOG.info("Setting compression " + hcd.getCompressionType().name() +
814                      " for family " + hcd.toString());
815           }
816           reader.loadFileInfo();
817           first = reader.getFirstRowKey();
818           last =  reader.getLastRowKey();
819 
820           LOG.info("Trying to figure out region boundaries hfile=" + hfile +
821             " first=" + Bytes.toStringBinary(first) +
822             " last="  + Bytes.toStringBinary(last));
823 
824           // To eventually infer start key-end key boundaries
825           Integer value = map.containsKey(first)? map.get(first):0;
826           map.put(first, value+1);
827 
828           value = map.containsKey(last)? map.get(last):0;
829           map.put(last, value-1);
830         }  finally {
831           reader.close();
832         }
833       }
834     }
835 
836     keys = LoadIncrementalHFiles.inferBoundaries(map);
837     this.hbAdmin.createTable(htd,keys);
838 
839     LOG.info("Table "+ tableName +" is available!!");
840   }
841 
842   @Override
843   public int run(String[] args) throws Exception {
844     if (args.length != 2) {
845       usage();
846       return -1;
847     }
848 
849     String dirPath   = args[0];
850     TableName tableName = TableName.valueOf(args[1]);
851 
852     boolean tableExists   = this.doesTableExist(tableName);
853     if (!tableExists) this.createTable(tableName,dirPath);
854 
855     Path hfofDir = new Path(dirPath);
856     HTable table = new HTable(this.cfg, tableName);
857 
858     doBulkLoad(hfofDir, table);
859     return 0;
860   }
861 
862   public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
863     int ret = ToolRunner.run(new LoadIncrementalHFiles(HBaseConfiguration.create()), args);
864     System.exit(ret);
865   }
